article:
A few years ago, I went running on a   _  day. It was my favorite activity
because the streets were so  _  when it rained.  _  , I saw an old man with  _  clothes
picking cans out of a rubbish bin. When I ran past him, I didn't know  _  I should give him my umbrella. As I was  _  ,
I was still running. But I finally decided to give him my umbrella, as I knew
he needed the umbrella much more than I needed it,  _  I
ran back, gave him the umbrella and said, "You need this more than I  _  ." To my surprise, he took it  _  a big smile on
his face and repeated, "Thank you! Thank you! God bless you." I hadn't expected
he would  _  it so much. I walked away feeling  _  . When I turned back, I  _  him still there,
smiling. "It was just an umbrella," I thought, not  _  that
it was the  _  that made him happy. He might feel
that he wasn't  _  in the world.
    A few weeks later, when I was running on the same street on a bright sunny day, I  passed by  the
same man who was in the same clothes sitting down resting. The only  _  was my umbrella right beside him, looking like he  _  it.
It was very clean and neatly placed. At that moment, I realized it didn't  _  that I couldn't give him a house or a job. I only did what I
was able to and it made a whole lot of  _  seem to go
away.
